result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:09 AM 2021CF000073, 2021CF000154, 2022CF000020, 2022CF000097, 2022CF000101 - Defendant David A. Gillingham in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for David A. Gillingham.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt states that they are prepared to enter a plea on 2021CF000073, 2022CF000101 and asking for a presentence investigation. Attorney Harper states that all others will be dismissed and read in. Attorney Bartelt state that they will be enter a plea on 21CF73; count 1 and 22CF101; count 1, 2 and 5. Court goes over the defendant rights. Court finds a factual basis. Defendant enters a guilty plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

21CF73; count 1 - Court orders a PSI

22CF101; count 1, 2  and 5 -  Court orders a PSI

All other cases and counts will be dismissed and read in. 

Attorney Bartelt speaks about curfew and request that the curfew be change to accommodate the new shift change of work. Attorney Harper asks  that the defendant be home during the time of 5:30 PM to 5:00 AM. Discussion. 

Court orders that that defendant curfew be 6 PM at night and end at 5 AM.
Plea hearing on October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:15 PM 2021CF000154, 2022CF000020, 2022CF000097, 2022CF000101, 2021CF000073 - Defendant David A. Gillingham in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for David A. Gillingham.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt asks for a plea hearing. Attorney Bartelt asks to modify bond to adjust the curfew. (22CF97)  Attorney Bartelt states that the hours for work would be 2:45 PM to 12:30 AM. No objection with Attorney Harper.

Court modifies bond to "Defendant  is allow to leave his home from 11 AM to 12 pm daily to do business in town. Defendant is allow to go to and from work during the hours of 11 AM to 1:30 AM."
Plea hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:21 PM 22CF20, 21CF154, 21CF73, 22CF101, 22CF97, 22CM83 - Defendant David A. Gillingham appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for David A. Gillingham.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF101, 22CF97- Attorney Bartelt waives the preliminary hearing. DG concurs. Court binds over for trial.  Attorney Harper has filed the information in both cases that will bring forth the same charges. Attorney Bartelt waives the formal reading and stand mute in both cases.

Attorney Bartelt address bond on 22CF97 and ask for a lower cash bond. Attorney Harper comments about the defendant prior history and asks that the $5,000 cash bond continue. 

Court denies the bond modification.

State ask that the defendant remain on his address if the $1,000 cash bond.
Court speaks about a curfew. State asks for 6 PM to 6 AM.

Court will modify bond condition to add a curfew of  6 PM to 6 AM. Defendant must be at his residence from 6 PM to 6 AM.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant's family member called COC office and stated that mail to the Defendant is arriving there (on Rosses Road) but Defendant does not live there; request for that address to be removed from the record.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:11 PM 2021CF000154, 2022CF000020, 2021CF000073 - Defendant David A. Gillingham in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared by video for David A. Gillingham.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt states that  they are working on getting DG into treatment court. Attorney Harper states that DG is eligible for treatment court.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on June 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt state that her client was in the Iowa County Jail. Attorney Bartelt asks for a reset for 06/26/22. Court  advises that Attorney Bartelt can make the arrangements for his client to appear by Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:33 AM 2021CF000154, 2022CF000020, 2021CF000073 -Defendant David A. Gillingham not in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for David A. Gillingham.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt state that her client was in the Iowa County Jail. Attorney Bartelt asks for a reset for 06/26/22. Court  advises that Attorney Bartelt can make the arrangements for his client to appear by Zoom.
From Treatment Court RE: Application Accepted.
No contact with the residence. (588 South Park Street, Richland Center, WI 53581)
Adjourned initial appearance on April 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:14 PM 21CF73/21CF154/22CF20 Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared by video means for Defendant David A. Gillingham. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt hasn't seen the complaint in 22CF20. Attorney Harper states that DG is on a P and P hold.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
(Bond was forwarded to RCSD for Def's signature. As of 2/23/22, he hasn't signed it yet.)
